question: Who has been elected as the first female President of Slovakia?
explanation: Zuzana Caputova, a liberal environmental activist and a political newcomer, has been elected as the first female President of Slovakia. She framed the election as a struggle between good and evil. With 58% of the vote, Caputova edged out European Commission Vice President Maros Sefcovic, a diplomat backed by the county\'s governing Smer-Social Democracy party. She  is set to take office on June 15, after the tenure of incumbent Slovak President Andrej Kiska finishes.
